newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Telkom's Metrosel to invest 196 bln rph.
newsitem.headline: Telkom's Metrosel to invest 196 bln rph.

text.p: Indonesia's PT Metro Selular Nusantara (Metrosel), a unit of telecommunications giant PT Telekomunikasi Indonesia (Telkom), said on Friday it planned to invest up to 196 billion rupiah in 1997 to improve services.

"Investment in 1997 will be at 196 billion rupiah. The financing is expected to come from foreign strategic partners as equity participation," Metrosel said in a statement to a parliamentary commission hearing.
It said it had a total of 23,050 subscribers as of January 20, with 13,503 coming from east Java, 9,387 from central Java and the remaining 160 from other regions in eastern Indonesia.
The statement did not give further details.
Metrosel is a cellular phone company operating mostly in east and central Java.
